projects.title: “Development of a Multimodal Seizure Detection Instrument to Improve out-of-hospital safety and disease management of Epilepsy Patients”
projects.description:
The project is developed in a consortium with Zwolle, Utreht and Kempenhaeghe hospitals. My responsibilities and my work are connected to work package 1 (WP1) “Remote sensing modalities”.
The aim is to build an automated remote sensing system capable of detecting and identifying epileptic seizures by analysing video and audio. It can run on a low-end platform, e.g. a desktop PC or laptop. 
 Furthermore it can be applied as a stand-alone application and as a modular extension to other systems.
 The input is provided by a video camera (infrared sensitive for night observation) and a directed microphone. The video signal is processed using so called optic flow algorithms. These reconstruct the velocity field of moving objects from the intensity variations in video time sequences. The audio signal is filtered and its variation is analysed to detect possible epileptic seizures...

projects.title: “Dynamic Modelling of Complex Brain Networks”
projects.description:
A collaboration between King'a College of London and University of Exeter, 
 Development of methods for the inference and analysis of complex brain networks. 
 The main aims: to elucidate the dynamic mechanisms responsible for the initiation of seizures 
 and to understand how the brain networks of people with epilepsy 
 or another cerebral hyper synchrony disease and close family members, 
 differ from the general population.

company.name: Sofia University, “Big Data for Smart Society” Institute, Research and Innovation Department

profile_positions.company: Sofia University, “Big Data for Smart Society” Institute, Research and Innovation Department
profile_positions.description:
The Strategic goal in Digital Health is to use Big Data as the centre of Digital Transformation with all the invented methods and Data-Enabled opportunities to create meaningful innovations that improve human lives.
The activities in Digital Health are based on the research experience related to the creation of methods from all areas of human knowledge, using Data analytics, AI, ML, DL, system identification and analysis, dynamic models, biostatistics, bioinformatics and their application for solving real biomedical problems, known as Translational Medicine.
Our activity within Digital Health started from Translational Medicine's most complex and significant part, namely, the human brain and related diseases, called Translational Neuroscience. It provides a closer interaction between basic and clinical neuroscientists to expand understanding of brain structure, function and disease and translate this knowledge into clinical applications and novel therapies for nervous system disorders.
Our Tactical goals in Digital Health are to contribute via Innovations, Big Data analytics, algorithms, AI, ML, DL and Digital Transformation to Long-life Healthy living through all its phases: Prevention, Diagnosis, Treatment and Home Care.
profile_positions.title: Research Group Lead in Digital Health

profile_positions.description:
Innovative Nonstandard Solutions and Applications based on Remote sensing Modalities for Infant care.
Projects: Video Stabilization; Respiratory rate Detection, Central Apnea Warning, Heart Rate Detection, Baby Movement detection, Camera movement remote detection in video sequences &  real-time video observation; “Track & Trace” objects in the video; Detection of pre-defined behavioural patterns in real-time video observation; Areas: Computer Vision; AI; Computational Neuroscience; Algorithms; Real-time applications + 2 patent applications on the subject.
profile_positions.title: Principal Investigator

profile_positions.company: SEIN - Expertisecentrum voor epilepsie en slaapgeneeskunde
profile_positions.description:
Medical Technology.
Projects: LICSENSE/PROMISE (“Tele-Epilepsy” - continuation Image and Signal Analysis) “Real-time video detection”. Methods & Areas: The challenge is to improve the algorithm performance, by increasing the specificity of detection that allows for better differentiate epileptic seizures from movement patterns not related to epileptic activity. I'm directly involved in the development, validation and implementation of the final version of the algorithms into a clinical product ; Skills: Computational Neuroscience; Computer Vision, Algorithms; Real-time applications; MATLAB
profile_positions.title: Researcher
